snippet: "Anyplace" is an adverb that means the same thing as "anywhere." But there's a difference: "anyplace" is generally considered colloquial or informal. It should generally be avoided in serious and straight-news contexts. Use "anywhere" instead: "He...
abstract: "Anyplace" is an adverb that means the same thing as "anywhere." But there's a difference: "anyplace" is generally considered colloquial or informal. It should generally be avoided in serious and straight-news contexts. Use "anywhere" instead: "He could not find a good cup of coffee anywhere."
